articles.title: Sirui Wan
articles.contents:
Sirui Wan
          
          
          Home
          CV
          Publications
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Sirui Wan
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        ResearchGate
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Google Scholar
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I am an educational and developmental psychologist
            studying why people pursue/avoid specific educational
            trajectories and career paths. The ultimate goal of my
            research is to imply how to help students, especially those
            from historically underrepresented and marginalized groups,
            fulfill their potential.
            I am currently a postdoctoral researcher in the
            Department of Psychology at the University of
            Wisconsin-Madison, working with Dr. Judith
            Harackiewicz. I earned my Ph.D. from the School of
            Education at the University of California, Irvine where I
            worked with Drs. Drew H. Bailey
            and Jacquelynne
            S. Eccles.
            My work has been published in journals such as
            Psychological Bulletin, Child Development,
            Developmental Psychology, and Proceedings of
            the National Academy of Sciences. I am a recipient of
            multiple honors, including the
            APA Dissertation Research Award, the
            Graduate Student Research Excellence Award from AERA
            Division C, and the
            UCI Graduate Dean’s Dissertation Fellowship.
            
            photo credit: Steve Zylius / UC Irvine

              Psychological Bulletin, Child
              Development, Developmental Psychology, and

articles.title: Publications
articles.description:
Umarji, O., Wan, S., Wolff, F., & Eccles, J. S. (in press). The System of Academic Task Values: The Development of Cross-Domain Comparisons of Values and College Major Choice. Developmental Psychology.

Wan, S., Brick, T. R., Alvarez-Vargas, D., & Bailey, D. H. (2022). Triangulating on Developmental Models with a Combination of Experimental and Non-Experimental Estimates. Developmental Psychology. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/364756683_Triangulating_on_Developmental_Models_with_a_Combination_of_Experimental_and_Non-_Experimental_Estimates)

Wan, S., Lauermann, F., Bailey, D. H., & Eccles, J. S. (2022). Developmental Changes in Students’ Use of Dimensional Comparisons to Form Ability Self-Concepts in Math and Verbal Domains. Child Development. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/364371307_Developmental_changes_in_students'_use_of_dimensional_comparisons_to_form_ability_self-concepts_in_math_and_verbal_domains)

Tang, X., Lee, H., Wan, S., Gaspard, H., & Salmela-Aro, K. (2022). Situating Expectancies and Subjective Task Values Across Grade Levels, Domains, and Countries: A Network Approach. AERA Open. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/361607205_Situating_expectancies_and_subjective_task_values_across_grade_levels_domains_and_countries_A_network_approach)

Alvarez-Vargas, D., Wan, S., Fuchs, L., Klein, A., & Bailey, D. H. (2022). Design and Analytic Features for Reducing Biases in Skill-Building Intervention Impact Forecasts. Journal of Research on Educational Effectiveness. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/361830653_Design_and_Analytic_Features_for_Reducing_Biases_in_Skill-Building_Intervention_Impact_Forecasts)

Wan, S., Lauermann, F., Bailey, D. H., & Eccles, J. S. (2021). When do students begin to think that one has to be either a “math person” or a “language person”? A meta-analytic review. Psychological Bulletin, 147(9), 867–889. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/354873791_When_Do_Students_Begin_to_Think_That_One_Has_to_Be_Either_a_Math_Person_or_a_Language_Person_A_Meta-Analytic_Review)

Qiu, K., Chen, E., Wan, S., & Bailey, D. H. (2021). A multilevel meta-analysis on the causal effect of ANS training on symbolic math performance. Journal of Experimental Psychology: Learning, Memory, and Cognition, 47(11), 1820–1835. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/355081264_A_multilevel_meta-analysis_on_the_causal_effect_of_ANS_training_on_symbolic_math_performance)

Wan, S., Bond, T. N., Lang, K., Clements, D. H., Sarama, J., & Bailey, D. H. (2021). Is intervention fadeout a scaling artefact? Economics of Education Review, 82, 102090. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/349064407_Is_Intervention_Fadeout_a_Scaling_Artefact)

Cui, J., Zhang, Y., Wan, S., Chen, C., Zeng, J., & Zhou, X. (2019). Visual form perception is fundamental for both reading comprehension and arithmetic computation. Cognition, 189, 141-154. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/334838462_Visual_form_perception_is_fundamental_for_both_reading_comprehension_and_arithmetic_computation)

Rodic, M., Tikhomirova, T., Kolienko, T., Malykh, S., Bogdanova, O., Zueva, D. Y., Gynku, E. I., Wan, S., Zhou, X. and Kovas, Y. (2015). Spatial complexity of character based writing systems and arithmetic in primary school: a longitudinal study. Frontiers in Psychology. 6:333. [paper link](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/274070901_Spatial_complexity_of_character-based_writing_systems_and_arithmetic_in_primary_school_A_longitudinal_study?_sg%5B0%5D=9998KhtqCX3CzPBjyzNWzjx8KlJMR4-oniJ7UkLZhs3kAryKSgkHhqrcEAWUBtpyapVF4VUyzk7wAJlyeWoNzrZt6xE_JLTyiYlKNn_g.4NLu769AdgwyenQ7DHKV-zED9zrKoCA5Ide_jyxkL1WVBMk3Gm9ytkOI4Srh_RsZvFiqhhKk6o9DkWSL1yGD0g)
